info.title: Zig Zag Platform
info.description:
School transportation management API.
Provides endpoints for GPS tracking, route management, payments (Mercado Pago marketplace),
real-time alerts, attendance, and special event routing.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Absence resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of Absence resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a Absence resource.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of ActiveRoute resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of ActiveRoute resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a ActiveRoute resource.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of ActiveRouteStop resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of ActiveRouteStop resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a ActiveRouteStop resource.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Address resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of Address resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a Address resource.

get.summary: Get messages for an alert chat thread
get.description: Returns paginated, decrypted messages. Only the distressed driver, responding driver, or a school admin may read. Supports `?page=` and `?limit=` (max 50).

422.description: Chat is read-only (alert resolved) or missing content

post.summary: Post a message to an alert chat thread
post.description: Creates a new encrypted chat message for the emergency thread. Only the distressed driver, responding driver, or a school admin may post.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of ArchivedRoute resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of ArchivedRoute resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a ArchivedRoute resource.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Attendance resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of Attendance resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a Attendance resource.

403.description: Caller is not the session driver

409.description: An active distress alert already exists

422.description: Route session is not in progress

post.description: Triggers a distress alert for an in-progress route session. The caller must be the driver of the session.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Driver resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of Driver resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a Driver resource.

403.description: Caller is not authorised to resolve this alert

post.description: Marks the alert as RESOLVED. The caller must be the distressed driver, the responding driver, or a school admin.

200.description: Alert accepted — status set to responded

403.description: Caller was not notified of this alert

422.description: Alert is not in PENDING state

post.description: Sets the alert to RESPONDED and notifies the distressed driver via Mercure. The caller must be listed in the alert's nearbyDriverIds.
Ingests a GPS fix for a driver. Rate-limited to 1 update per 3 seconds per driver. Dispatches DriverLocationUpdatedMessage for async processing.
Ingests multiple GPS fixes for offline sync. Each item is individually validated; item-level failures are collected in the `errors` field.

404.description: Driver not found or no location data

get.description: Returns the driver's latest GPS position. Checks Redis cache first (15s TTL); falls back to DB.
Returns GPS history for a driver within a date range. Required query params: `start` and `end` (ISO 8601).

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of LocationUpdate resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of LocationUpdate resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

202.description: Accepted — event enqueued for async processing

post.description:
Receives a Mercado Pago payment notification. The request body is validated
using an HMAC-SHA256 signature carried in the `x-signature` and `x-request-id`
headers. Only payment-type events are processed; all other types are silently
acknowledged.

**Authentication:** None (JWT not required). Security is enforced by the
HMAC signature. If the signature is invalid the endpoint returns 401.

get.description: Retrieves a NotificationPreference resource.
Returns all payments belonging to the authenticated user. Supports optional `?status=` filter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by payment status (pending, processing, approved, failed, refunded, partially_refunded)

201.description: Preference created — returns preferenceId and checkout URLs

422.description: Driver has no MP account connected

post.summary: Create a Mercado Pago payment preference
post.description: Creates a payment preference on the Mercado Pago marketplace. The driver must have a connected MP account. An idempotency key prevents duplicate charges.

get.description: Returns full payment details including driver, students, and transaction history. Only the payment owner or a school admin may access.
Returns the current payment status. If the payment has a Mercado Pago ID, the status is synchronised in real time before being returned.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Route resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of Route resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a Route resource.

post.description: Creates a copy of the route and all its stops.
Optimizes the stop order and estimated arrival times, then persists the changes.
Returns the optimized stop order and timing data without persisting changes.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of RouteStop resources.
get.description: Retrieves the collection of RouteStop resources.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieves a RouteStop resource.

patch.description: Marks the route stop as active and confirmed. The caller must be the driver of the associated route.
Marks the route stop as inactive and unconfirmed. The caller must be the driver of the associated route.

get.description: Retrieves a Subscription resource.

get.summary: List unconfirmed route stops for the driver
get.description: Returns all active, unconfirmed route stops across the authenticated driver's routes. Requires ROLE_DRIVER.

AlertChatMessage.ChatMessageIdOutput-cha.description:
Virtual resource representing the emergency chat thread for a DriverAlert.

Two operations are exposed:
 - POST /driver-alerts/{alertId}/messages — post a message to the thread
 - GET  /driver-alerts/{alertId}/messages — fetch paginated messages

Access is restricted to chat participants (distressed driver, responding
driver, or school admin). The participant check is performed inside the
processor/provider since it requires the alert to be loaded first.

DistressSignal.DistressOutput-distress.r.description:
Virtual resource representing a driver distress signal.

There is no backing Doctrine entity. The driver POSTs to this endpoint to
trigger a distress alert for their active route session. The alert is
persisted and DriverDistressMessage is dispatched for async processing
(nearby driver notification, Mercure broadcast, etc.).

Security: ROLE_DRIVER required. The processor additionally validates
that the authenticated driver owns the given route session.

DistressSignal.DistressOutput.csv-distre.description:

(nearby driver notification, Mercure broadcast, etc.).

Security: ROLE_DRIVER required. The processor additionally validates
that the authenticated driver owns the given route session.

mpAccessToken.description: Encrypted MP access token (XSalsa20-Poly1305 via TokenEncryptor).

mpAccountId.description: MP seller account ID (user_id returned by OAuth).

mpTokenExpiresAt.description: When the current access token expires (MP tokens last ~180 days).

mpAuthorized.description: Returns true once the driver has completed the OAuth flow.

DriverAlertAction.AlertActionOutput-aler.description:
Virtual resource for DriverAlert state-transition operations.

There is no backing Doctrine entity — operations look up the DriverAlert
by its UUID alertId (URI variable) via DriverAlertRepository.

Two operations are exposed:
 - respond: ROLE_DRIVER; caller must be in nearbyDriverIds
 - resolve: ROLE_DRIVER (or ROLE_SCHOOL_ADMIN via hierarchy); caller must
            be distressedDriver, respondingDriver, or a school admin

            be distressedDriver, respondingDriver, or a school admin

DriverLocation.BatchLocationInput-tracki.description:
Virtual resource for GPS location tracking operations.

Four operations are exposed:
 - POST /tracking/location           — ingest a single GPS fix (ROLE_DRIVER)
 - POST /tracking/location/batch     — batch-ingest offline GPS points (ROLE_DRIVER)
 - GET  /tracking/location/driver/{driverId}         — latest location (ROLE_USER)
 - GET  /tracking/location/driver/{driverId}/history — location history (ROUTE_MANAGE)

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

UnconfirmedRouteStop.UnconfirmedStopsOut.description:
Virtual resource for listing unconfirmed route stops assigned to a driver.

The ROLE_DRIVER check is performed inside the provider (before any DB queries)
because AP4 evaluates `security:` after the provider returns for GET operations.

The ROLE_DRIVER check is performed inside the provider (before any DB queries)
because AP4 evaluates `security:` after the provider returns for GET operations.

tags.name: AlertChatMessage
tags.description:
Virtual resource representing the emergency chat thread for a DriverAlert.

Two operations are exposed:
 - POST /driver-alerts/{alertId}/messages — post a message to the thread
 - GET  /driver-alerts/{alertId}/messages — fetch paginated messages

Access is restricted to chat participants (distressed driver, responding
driver, or school admin). The participant check is performed inside the
processor/provider since it requires the alert to be loaded first.

tags.name: DistressSignal
tags.description:
Virtual resource representing a driver distress signal.

There is no backing Doctrine entity. The driver POSTs to this endpoint to
trigger a distress alert for their active route session. The alert is
persisted and DriverDistressMessage is dispatched for async processing
(nearby driver notification, Mercure broadcast, etc.).

Security: ROLE_DRIVER required. The processor additionally validates
that the authenticated driver owns the given route session.

tags.name: DriverAlertAction
tags.description:
Virtual resource for DriverAlert state-transition operations.

There is no backing Doctrine entity — operations look up the DriverAlert
by its UUID alertId (URI variable) via DriverAlertRepository.

Two operations are exposed:
 - respond: ROLE_DRIVER; caller must be in nearbyDriverIds
 - resolve: ROLE_DRIVER (or ROLE_SCHOOL_ADMIN via hierarchy); caller must
            be distressedDriver, respondingDriver, or a school admin

tags.name: DriverLocation
tags.description:
Virtual resource for GPS location tracking operations.

Four operations are exposed:
 - POST /tracking/location           — ingest a single GPS fix (ROLE_DRIVER)
 - POST /tracking/location/batch     — batch-ingest offline GPS points (ROLE_DRIVER)
 - GET  /tracking/location/driver/{driverId}         — latest location (ROLE_USER)
 - GET  /tracking/location/driver/{driverId}/history — location history (ROUTE_MANAGE)

tags.name: MercadoPagoWebhook
tags.description: Receives and enqueues Mercado Pago webhook notifications.

tags.name: UnconfirmedRouteStop
tags.description:
Virtual resource for listing unconfirmed route stops assigned to a driver.

The ROLE_DRIVER check is performed inside the provider (before any DB queries)
because AP4 evaluates `security:` after the provider returns for GET operations.

tags.name: Payment
tags.description: Manages Mercado Pago marketplace payments between parents and drivers.
